title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chaise Longue", March 17, 1937
medium: Graphite, red, blue, and green color pencil and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in stamp in graphite, lower right: 8596/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/DILLM./D./ 3.17.37, 3/18/37, 1, MASTER.; inscribed in graphite below perspective drawing, lower left: ONE CHAISE LONGUE/POLLARD OAK BURL BASE/ SIZE L. 56"/H. 27"/ W. 26 1/2"; inscribed in graphite with instructions, dimensions, materials.
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for chaise longue. Wide, rounded upholstered back with arms at each end; long, rectangular upholstered seat. Four short, squared and straight legs in burled pollard oak.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chaise Longue", March 17, 1937.
March 17, 1937. Graphite, red, blue, and green color pencil and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-943.
